name: 徐秉愉
objective: The purpose of this course is to provide students with basic information for understanding the historical development of China and the Chinese civilization from the formative stage to the end of the Qing Dynasty.
schedule:
Week 1: 2/23
Introduction
Week 2: 3/1
Geographical setting and the formative age
Week 3: 3/8
The first empire: Qin (221-206 BCE) 
Week 4: 3/15
The empire that last: Han (206 BCE-220 CE)
Week 5: 3/22
The era of division (220-589)
Week 6: 3/29
China reunified: The Northern Wei (439-534) and Sui (581-608) dynasties 
Week 7: 4/5
Holiday
Week 8: 4/12 
The cosmopolitan Tang Empire (618-907)
Week 9: 4/19
Review
Week 10: 4/26
Challengers from the north: the Liao (907-1125) and Jin (1115-1234)
Week 11: 5/3
Emperors and literati: The Northern (960-1127) and Southern Song (1127-1276)
Week 12: 5/10
The Mongols in China and in world history
Week 13: 5/17
Monarchs and ministers: The Ming (1368-1644)
Week 14: 5/24
The foundation of a world empire: The early Qing (1644-1800)
Week 15: 5/31
Challenges from the outside world: Decline and fall of the Qing Empire (1800-1911)
Week 16: 6/7
Review
scorePolicy:
Final grade will be based on the following:
Class participation             20%
Take-home midterm exam       40%
Final exam                    40%
materials:
Required Reading:
Ropp, Paul S. China in World History. Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2010.
Ebrey, Patricia Buckley. The Cambridge Illustrated history of China (Second Edition). Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2010.
